intro: Cuphea radula f. lanicaulis, commonly known as the woolly cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly foliage that gives it a unique appearance. The plant produces showy, tubular red or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. This ornamental plant is valued for its vibrant blooms and interesting foliage texture in gardens.
